text:
Yeah basic is good, it's always good to rough out your models in the base shapes to get the proportions right and then start the actual final piece.
And cool, which of these are you leaning towards, I'd strongly recommend doing just one :smiley:.
When it comes to proportions think about the 7.5 Head proportions rule, it will help get you a more believable character. Once you understand the realist proportion you can then start to mess around and play with it, but before anything it's important to get the foundations right, and then experiment. (For your male, for example has a small torso length wise compared to the rest)
And I am currently working on a game trailer for the Talking Tom IP, very cartoony fun stuff
